title.narrative: IR 1. STRATEGIES ACCELERAT. ACC ED BASE

description.narrative: By 2015, the strategies of accelerating access to a quality basic education are promoted, which contributes to Education In Emergencies, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equity â€“ Focus On Girls' And Inclusive Education, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2015, (i) the primary school Gross Enrolment Rate (GER) increases from 72.4% in 2008-2009 to 100%, with a special focus on vulnerable children and those with special needs and (ii) the primary school Completion Rate (CR) increases from 45.9% in 2009-2010 to 75.1%, with special focus on girls.

mailing-address.narrative: Immeuble des Nations Unies - Koulouba 01 BP 3420 - Ouagadougou 01

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2015, the strategies of accelerating access to a quality basic education are promoted

description.narrative: UNICEF's supports and advocacy led to an increased access to primary and preschool education, following a decision by the Government to expand preschool coverage from 2016/2017 school year onward. Support via QCFS and Education in emergency activities have ensured access to improved education for 178,747 children | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/03/2018
